questions.question: The principle of operation of firewire is:
options: (a) positive coefficient of impedance, negative coefficient of inductance
(b) positive coefficient of resistance, negative coefficient of capacitance
(c) positive coefficient of inductance, negative coefficient of impedance
(d) positive coefficient of capacitance, negative coefficient of resistance
questions.solution: (a) positive coefficient of impedance, negative coefficient of inductance

questions.question: What type of fire extinguisher would be used on a propane fire?
On what principle do smoke detectors work?
An ion detector detects:
If an artificial feel unit were fitted it would be connected:
options: (a) in parallel with the primary controls
(b) in series with the primary controls
(c) in series with the secondary controls
(d) in parallel with the secondary controls
questions.solution: (a) in parallel with the primary controls

questions.question: In a twin jet fuel system what is the function of a feeder box?
options: (a) To equally distribute the fuel to each tank during refuelling
(c) To feed fuel to the volumetric top-off unit
(d) To control the amount of fuel remaining during fuel dumping
questions.solution: (a) To equally distribute the fuel to each tank during refuelling

questions.question: A twin jet aircraft would normally be refuelled by which of the following methods?
The fuel tanks of a modern passenger airliner are filled by:
options: (b) fuel is sucked in by the aircraft pumps
(c) fuel is pumped in by the fuel truck

questions.question: The purpose of a refuelling volumetric top off unit (VTO) is:
options: (a) to keep the feeder box full of fuel at all times
(b) to close the fuelling valve when the tank is full
(c) to close the surge check valves in the outboard tanks to keep the tank full
(d) to close the tank vent system when the tank is full
questions.solution: (a) to keep the feeder box full of fuel at all times

questions.question: Fuel tank booster pumps are:
The advantage of a float type fuel gauging system is:
The function of the baffles in a fuel tank is:
options: (a) to prevent movement of fuel to the wingtip
(b) to prevent fuel surge (or sloshing) during manoeuvring
(d) to reduce fuel flow at altitude
questions.solution: (a) to prevent movement of fuel to the wingtip

questions.question: The function of baffle check valves in a fuel tank is:
options: (a) to reduce fuel flow at altitude
(b) to prevent fuel surge during manoeuvring
(d) to prevent movement of fuel to the wingtip
questions.solution: (a) to reduce fuel flow at altitude

questions.question: A magneto is switched off by:
An impulse coupling in a magneto is provided to:
options: (a) generate high voltage and advance the spark for starting
(b) increase the energy to the spark plug as the rpm increases
(c) generate high voltage and retard the spark for starting
(d) allows a low energy value when ‘continuous ignition’ is selected
questions.solution: (a) generate high voltage and advance the spark for starting

questions.question: A turbosupercharger impeller is driven by:

(b) diversion of exhaust gases by the wastegate using energy that would
(c) excess torque from the reduction gearbox
questions.solution: (a) a connection through a gearbox connected to the crankshaft

questions.question: A cylinder head temperature gauge measures:
options: (a) the temperature of the hottest cylinder
(b) the temperature of all the cylinders and gives an average reading
(c) the temperature of the coolest cylinder
(d) the temperature of the two cylinders furthest away from each other divided
questions.solution: (a) the temperature of the hottest cylinder

questions.question: EPR is measured by the ratio of:

(d) exhaust pressure to low pressure compressor inlet pressure
questions.solution: (a) turbine pressure to combustion chamber inlet pressure

questions.question: Where is EGT measured?

(b) Goes through the compressor, turbine, secondary heat exchanger
(c) Goes through the turbine, compressor and secondary heat exchanger
(d) Goes through the compressor, secondary heat exchanger, turbine
questions.solution: (a) Goes through the primary heat exchanger, compressor then secondary heat

questions.question: How are the loads on an aircraft busbar connected?
options: (a) They are in series so that current reduces through the busbar as loads are
(b) They are in parallel so that voltage reduces through the busbar as loads are
(c) They are in parallel so that current reduces through the busbar as loads are
(d) They are in series so that voltage reduces through the busbar as loads are
questions.solution: (a) They are in series so that current reduces through the busbar as loads are

questions.question: In a centrifugal compressor:

(b) the air enters the periphery axially and leaves the eye tangentially
(c) the air enters the eye radially and leaves the tip tangentially
(d) the air enters the impeller axially at the eye and leaves at the periphery
questions.solution: (a) the air enters the eye tangentially and leaves the periphery axially

questions.question: What happens to pressure, temperature and velocity of the air in the diffuser of a

questions.question: The purpose of a hydraulic fuse is to:

(b) allow a reduced pressure to the wheel brake system to avoid locking the
(c) prevent over-pressurizing the reservoir as altitude increases
(d) prevent loss of system fluid if the pipeline to a brake unit should rupture
questions.solution: (a) allow the parking brake to remain on overnight if required

questions.question: A shuttle valve will:

questions.question: If an aircraft maximum operating altitude is limited by the pressure cabin, this limit

questions.solution: (a) the maximum positive pressure differential at maximum operating ceiling

questions.question: What are flaperons?

(b) To reduce wing twisting at low speed
(c) To reduce wing bending at low speed
(d) To reduce wing twist at high speed
questions.solution: (a) To reduce wing bending at high speed

questions.solution: (a) To reduce stick forces in manoeuvres

questions.solution: (a) gaseous, diluted with ambient air if required

questions.question: If during pressurized flight the outflow valve closes fully due to a fault in the
options: (a) skin will be overstressed and could rupture

questions.question: In a fan jet engine the bypass ratio is:

questions.solution: (a) internal mass airflow divided by external mass airflow

questions.question: In very cold weather the pilot notices slightly higher than normal oil pressure on
options: (a) indicates an oil change is required.

options: (a) the gauge will show full scale high

questions.question: The requirement for an aircraft to have a fuel dumping system is:

questions.question: Which is the correct statement regarding a large aircraft fitted with both inboard
options: (a) The outboard ailerons are used only when the landing gear is selected down
(b) The outboard ailerons are used only when the landing gear is retracted
(c) The inboard ailerons are used only when the flaps are retracted

questions.solution: (a) The outboard ailerons are used only when the landing gear is selected down

questions.question: How do differential ailerons work?
options: (a) Increase lift on down going wing and decrease lift on up going wing
(b) Increase drag on up going wing and decrease drag on down going wing
(c) Equalize the drag on up going and down going wings
(d) Equalize the lift on up going and down going wings
questions.solution: (a) Increase lift on down going wing and decrease lift on up going wing

questions.question: What is the effect of heating flight deck windows?

(c) To protect the windows against ice formation
(d) To protect the windows against bird strike and ice formation
questions.solution: (a) To demist the interior of the window if normal demist does not function

questions.question: If an aircraft suffers decompression what happens to the indications on a cabin VSI,
options: (a) VSI up, altimeter up, differential pressure gauge down
(b) VSI, altimeter, differential pressure gauge all unchanged
(c) VSI down, altimeter up, differential pressure gauge down
(d) VSI up, altimeter down, differential pressure gauge down
questions.solution: (a) VSI up, altimeter up, differential pressure gauge down

questions.question: What happens if a gaseous oxygen cylinder is over-pressurized?
options: (a) A pressure relief valve vents the excess pressure into the atmosphere
(b) A bursting disc vents the complete contents of the cylinder(s) to atmosphere
(c) A pressure regulator will prevent the excess pressure damaging the system
(d) A pressure relief valve vents the excess pressure into the fuselage
questions.solution: (a) A pressure relief valve vents the excess pressure into the atmosphere

questions.question: If a fuel sample appears cloudy, this is:

questions.question: Differential ailerons work by:

(b) increasing drag on up going wing and decreasing drag on down going wing

questions.question: A fixed pitch propeller blade has wash-out from root to tip in order to:

(b) keep the pitch angle constant along the blade length

questions.solution: (a) keep the local angle of attack constant along the blade length
